data.title: Substance Is "The Totality of Accidents". This Term Does Not Get A Definition
data.meta_description:
Becoming Xvi1 - Free download as Word Doc (.doc), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. 1) McTaggart is critical of Hegel's presentation of necessity, possibility, and contingency as categories inserted between inner and outer and substance. 

2) McTaggart argues that substance should be directly derived from inner and outer, without these intervening categories. 

3) McTaggart also criticizes Hegel's transition from absolute necessity to substance, saying necessity is really a form of causality, which substance later derives from. This would contradict the dialectic's progressive structure.
data.text: Substance Is "The Totality of Accidents". This Term Does Not Get A Definition
